name: Lord Koku
title: The Hollowed Eternal
weapons: Staff of the Prince of Death – a runed staff that channels white-purple necromantic flame
equipment: Runic obsidian robes etched with glowing sigils
Crown of Stillness – a circlet that bends silence and memory
Bone talismans bound with soul-thread
lore: Before stories learned to end, there was Koku — the principle of Stillness given form. He is not merely the god of death, but the boundary that makes life meaningful. Ruling from Shadehaven Castle in the Land of Solitude, Lord Koku commands legions of ash-bound dead, weaving their echoes into the tapestry of endings he tends.

name: Bael Pax
title: The Hollowed Echo
weapons: Echostill – a greatsword that carries the souls of those he has personally felled, humming with their whispers
equipment: Charred plate armor cracked with inner white fire
Cloak of drifting cinders
Sigils of Lord Koku burned into his helm
lore: Once a giant among early humans, Bael Pax fell in a doomed last stand. Lord Koku offered him a second existence: rise as a deathknight and become the first echo of Koku's will. Now his armor is forever cracked with furnace-light, ash spilling from each step. Echostill drinks the voices of the fallen, binding them to the Cindered Legion.

name: Dova
title: Warden of the Veiled Judgment
weapons: Veilblade – a sword formed from a wand, changing shape based on the judgment he passes
equipment: Half-light, half-shadow mantle that shifts with his decisions
Mask of the Unseen Verdict
Chains of spectral ink that bind condemned souls
lore: Dova walks between light and dark, a being woven from both mercy and condemnation. He keeps the prison at the edge of Shadehaven, where souls await their final verdict. His wand unfolds into Veilblade, its edge altering with each sentence — gentle for the absolved, cruel for the damned.

name: Vhagar
title: The Unbroken Flame
weapons: His indomitable will and bare fists, burning with remnant dragonfire
equipment: Scorched wraps around his arms and knuckles
Tattered cloak that smells of smoke and rain
Dragon-scale fragments embedded beneath his skin
lore: Vhagar was once a dragon who chose to shed his scaled form and walk as a man. The fire never left him — it simply moved inward, into resolve and rage. He wanders the edges of the Land of Solitude, striking down tyrants and monsters alike.

name: Follower of Stillness
title: Acolyte of Shadehaven
weapons: Whispershard – a bone staff that channels the quiet of unmade worlds
equipment: Tattered obsidian robes that never stir in the wind
Rattle of ivory prayer beads etched with runes of silence
Hood that hides a skeletal visage lit by pale inner glow
lore: Before time and creation, when there was only Stillness, the first acolytes were shaped from bone and intent. This Follower of Stillness has served Lord Koku since before stories learned to begin. Their duty is simple and eternal: preserve the hush between heartbeats and guide new dead into Shadehaven's embrace.

name: Cindered Death Knight
title: Blade of the Hollowed Echo
weapons: Ashrend – a jagged greatsword wreathed in slow-falling embers
equipment: Blackened plate armor fused with cooled slag
Cloak of smoke that trails behind each step
Cinderbrand sigil upon the chest, marking loyalty to Bael Pax
lore: When Bael Pax was named general of Lord Koku's armies, the first to swear oath became the Cindered Death Knights. This warrior is one of those ironclad followers, their mortal name burned away in the furnace of allegiance. They march without rest, an extension of Bael's will.

name: Veiled Scholar
title: Student of Judgment
weapons: Quill of Balance – a feathered wand that records every verdict in invisible ink
equipment: Layered veils obscuring their eyes but not their insight
Scrolls bound in silver chain, each holding a different doctrine of judgment
Lantern of Soft Dawn, revealing the true weight of a heart
lore: Under Dova's watchful presence, Veiled Scholars study the intricate dance between guilt and grace. Each verdict, each hesitation, becomes a lesson — not just in punishment, but in the possibilities of redemption.

name: Infernal Wyvern
title: Acolyte of the Unbroken Flame
weapons: Claws and ember-breath, not yet a full dragon's roar but deadly all the same
equipment: Young scale-plates mottled with ember-orange and soot-black
Bronze collar marked with Vhagar's sigil
Wing wraps inscribed with oaths of loyalty to the Wandering Flame
lore: The Infernal Wyvern is an early dragonborn, not yet ascended into full draconic might. Drawn to Vhagar's path, they wander as a disciple of the Unbroken Flame, learning to temper fire with purpose.
